paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant p.Ser43Asn, including penetrance data from affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: transthyretin amyloidosis with cardiac and gastrointestinal manifestations

individual_records.phenotype_details: hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, heart failure, sensory-motor polyneuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient was evaluated in a hospital unit of the Social Security Institute—Manuel Ygnacio Monteros Hospital, where he continued his evaluations and follow-up.

individual_records.phenotype_details: significant edema in lower limbs, heart failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 49-year-old patient from Loja came to the outpatient clinic at Manuel Ygnacio Monteros-IESS Loja Hospital due to significant edema in the lower limbs.

individual_records.phenotype_details: third-degree AV block, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, heart failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient, 62 years old, male, from the province of Loja, resident in Quilanga, transferred from another hospital unit for pacemaker placement due to a diagnosis of third-degree AV block.

functional_data.summary: The p.Ser43Asn variant is associated with reduced monomer stability and amyloid formation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families, as evidenced by family tree analysis.
variants.population_frequency: Not found in general population databases (Exome Variant Server, Genome Aggregation Database)
variants.evidence_level: likely pathogenic based on functional analyses and familial segregation
variants.additional_notes: The variant is considered rare and has been reported in multiple case studies.
key_quotes: The p.Ser43Asn variant, also known as Ser23Asn, is a point mutation in exon 2, codon 43 of the TTR gene that leads to the substitution of a single amino acid.
This variant is considered to likely be pathogenic.

tables_processed.table_caption: Clinical characteristics of the 3 clinical cases

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene variant was extracted thoroughly.
